document.title: Public Schools of North Carolina, State Board of Education | Department of Instruction

3B82E68E1A464254B41F7A3D3FB2D05D.description: Analyze patterns and describe relationships between two variables in context. Using technology, determine the correlation coefficient of bivariate data and interpret it as a measure of the strength and direction of a linear relationship. Use a scatter plot, correlation coefficient, and a residual plot to determine the appropriateness of using a linear function to model a relationship between two variables.

EE9176A90186445E9F7D4B56E859B757.description: Interpret in context the rate of change and the intercept of a linear model. Use the linear model to interpolate and extrapolate predicted values. Assess the validity of a predicted value.

2AA00B8F564845F9ACF1897E32BD9C6B.description:
Interpreting Categorical and Quantitative Data
Interpret linear models.

CDE84FB3AB7E41F3BD89DD7F6B761011.description: Fit a function to exponential data using technology. Use the fitted function to solve problems.

4AD8392B891944ACB87A809B2267424C.description: Assess the fit of a linear function by analyzing residuals.

57D748258B4440B4B4B3677A8FBE8A4F.description: Fit a least squares regression line to linear data using technology. Use the fitted function to solve problems.

D15D1F62272747D098F3B15796D413DA.description: Represent data on two quantitative variables on a scatter plot, and describe how the variables are related.

071A8D382F3546B8B6F3E18B0FB00DD7.description:
Interpreting Categorical and Quantitative Data
Summarize, represent, and interpret data on two categorical and quantitative variables.

2C2CE2CCA4504B33BEB1D88E726F1875.description: Examine the effects of extreme data points (outliers) on shape, center, and/or spread.

56267DFC56F74BEF8545DC210DC4BA0C.description:
Use statistics appropriate to the shape of the data distribution to compare center (median, mean) and spread (interquartile range,
standard deviation) of two or more different data sets. Interpret differences in shape, center, and spread in the context of the data
sets.

7CF94E788A1743988A3994AD7601F815.description: Use technology to represent data with plots on the real number line (histograms, and box plots)

B9627AD5157F4433BB15E7FAE8B1D8AE.description: Interpreting Categorical and Quantitative Data Summarize, represent, and interpret data on a single count or measurement variable.

0522C993CCCA48A3BC59DC40253541B1.description: Use coordinates to find the midpoint or endpoint of a line segment

E958ECC8B64645FCAEB42F7D437ABA6C.description: Find the equation of a line parallel or perpendicular to a given line that passes through a given point.

B2648392D98F49BEB60E97120883323B.description: Determine if two lines are parallel, perpendicular, or neither.

2E93062E9F574C519DCEE5AC2EF81A7F.description: Use coordinates to prove the slope criteria for parallel and perpendicular lines and use them to solve problems.

F609A895A1DB4505AC5E458B0F4C5F04.description: Use coordinates to verify algebraically that a given set of points produces a particular type of triangle or quadrilateral.

C093F04FEC5A4B31967E635BBE3D4F2C.description: Use coordinates to compute perimeters of polygons and areas of triangles and rectangles

A58D242150A54466BD72EC7D0EA5BCB3.description: Use coordinates to solve geometric problems involving polygons algebraically

A8820A68C0FF43B2B1877B1A8D9E0344.description: Expressing Geometric Properties with Equations Use coordinates to prove simple geometric theorems algebraically.

33796367CD2C4A3A801A3B20D6C20D7B.description:
Interpret the parameters 𝑎 and 𝑏 in a linear function 𝑓(𝑥) = 𝑎𝑥 + 𝑏 or an exponential function 𝑔(𝑥) = 𝑎𝑏
𝑥
 in terms of a
context.

CD83A309F0EB4C94870077F4E5F62B1E.description:
Linear, Quadratic, and Exponential Models
Interpret expressions for functions in terms of the situation they model.

CB199BE478224AB582AC08F032088CE2.description:
Compare the end behavior of linear, exponential, and quadratic functions using graphs and tables to show that a quantity
increasing exponentially eventually exceeds a quantity increasing linearly or quadratically.

0FBBDA26ED954F6C947FA30607C42515.description: Identify situations that can be modeled with linear and exponential functions, and justify the most appropriate model for a situation based on the rate of change over equal intervals.

E3F1BDFBF5BF4F6B8ED6D249A73F5B0D.description: Linear, Quadratic, and Exponential Models Construct and compare linear and exponential models and solve problems.

369BFA7D2C0348668B49E53CC2C89F0B.description: Translate between explicit and recursive forms of arithmetic and geometric sequences and use both to model situations.

BC9F779AFF22473688149EA391F4A236.description:
Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities by combining linear, exponential, or quadratic
functions with addition and subtraction or two linear functions with multiplication.

99123DB0A58F4A789445E575B9604845.description:
Build linear and exponential functions, including arithmetic and geometric sequences, given a graph, a description of a
relationship, or two ordered pairs (include reading these from a table).

C2F9E0BC45EC4F69936288E696229D2C.description: Write a function that describes a relationship between two quantities

493674AF0A3F48E6AE779319F8859B1A.description: Building Functions Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities.

2ED80EA0C47C4ABF91FEB0F5E23FC13A.description: Compare key features of two functions (linear, quadratic, or exponential) each with a different representation (symbolically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions)

0F1502377E04452A8E6F3FE1AF249995.description: Interpret and explain growth and decay rates for an exponential function.

8FE0A5F73E74419DBBCC20F1D80432D3.description: Rewrite a quadratic function to reveal and explain different key features of the function

AC4DBDBAC2D44907B12309EB4104D177.description: Use equivalent expressions to reveal and explain different properties of a function

AA4DFBB2BB33498B85ED729898B60D8E.description: Analyze linear, exponential, and quadratic functions by generating different representations, by hand in simple cases and using technology for more complicated cases, to show key features, including: domain and range; rate of change; intercepts; intervals where the function is increasing, decreasing, positive, or negative; maximums and minimums; and end behavior.

3C22D652EC6441A487B629B62E01BC5C.description: Interpreting Functions Analyze functions using different representations.

4A0EB368F3B24BA5BAA10983F35D8658.description: Calculate and interpret the average rate of change over a specified interval for a function presented numerically, graphically, and/or symbolically.

5156660B8F2B426B91EF97391055E582.description:
Interpret a function in terms of the context by relating its domain and range to its graph and, where applicable, to the quantitative
relationship it describes.

047A8D09AB5E453690FF222D9BFA7EFB.description:
Interpret key features of graphs, tables, and verbal descriptions in context to describe functions that arise in applications relating
two quantities, including: intercepts; intervals where the function is increasing, decreasing, positive, or negative; and maximums
and minimums.

51B399DB173146CAA65625EE97997EE0.description: Interpreting Functions Interpret functions that arise in applications in terms of the context.

25CD97F6A3204686B037F0A3B0896BB9.description:
Recognize that recursively and explicitly defined sequences are functions whose domain is a subset of the integers, the terms of
an arithmetic sequence are a subset of the range of a linear function, and the terms of a geometric sequence are a subset of the
range of an exponential function.

E3810D45763C4153B28C6C7B5D6C089E.description:
Use function notation to evaluate linear, quadratic, and exponential functions for inputs in their domains, and interpret statements
that use function notation in terms of a context.

2ACA33FF368C4396911EF3BF2E752EE8.description: The graph of 𝑓 is the graph of the equation 𝑦 = 𝑓(𝑥).

926FC2AD239149FF8818F1BF8266EECA.description: If f is a function and x is an element of its domain, then 𝑓(𝑥) denotes the output of f corresponding to the input x.

7A43AB037ED04A03A41BDD947A1E0F2F.description:
Build an understanding that a function from one set (called the domain) to another set (called the range) assigns to each element
of the domain exactly one element of the range by recognizing that:

F96A007AA2C34016AEA577FD1E748099.description:
Interpreting Functions
Understand the concept of a function and use function notation.

F2D1F4570C3F42F39161BCCB431B4419.description: Represent the solutions of a linear inequality or a system of linear inequalities graphically as a region of the plane.

5FB48849544246EF93C07081E063E309.description: Build an understanding of why the x-coordinates of the points where the graphs of two linear, exponential, and/or quadratic equations 𝑦 = 𝑓(𝑥) and 𝑦 = 𝑔(𝑥) intersect are the solutions of the equation 𝑓(𝑥) = 𝑔(𝑥) and approximate solutions using graphing technology or successive approximations with a table of values.

90FA822283D249D79BD3AA00B7EED682.description: Understand that the graph of a two variable equation represents the set of all solutions to the equation.

F6B9B9AA912A494FBE0484527D53B4AF.description:
Reasoning with Equations and Inequalities
Represent and solve equations and inequalities graphically

0BFA078675704A79AC32AE6D495A452F.description:
Use tables, graphs, or algebraic methods (substitution and elimination) to find approximate or exact solutions to systems of linear
equations and interpret solutions in terms of a context.

DC4F8D29B78B4EF685B94CB82A740E16.description: Explain why replacing one equation in a system of linear equations by the sum of that equation and a multiple of the other produces a system with the same solutions

B8E56C411793451C97A78498044BC78E.description: Reasoning with Equations and Inequalities Solve systems of equations.

8937492382E84814954980E9A8E7F63F.description: Solve for the real solutions of quadratic equations in one variable by taking square roots and factoring.

CADB0B472DF14658B3FCA7CF0D5F454D.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable.

00BE4BFF27E94097957E62B4A2817D54.description: Reasoning with Equations and Inequalities Solve equations and inequalities in one variable

2AA1F63EB7994020ADCD37C66BE29A40.description:
Justify a chosen solution method and each step of the solving process for linear and quadratic equations using mathematical
reasoning.

A72A2B690D8243D1BCE563D2E4783CD7.description:
Reasoning with Equations and Inequalities
Understand solving equations as a process of reasoning and explain the reasoning

4EA12F1DFCBC4C01B79F7AF4D0C20DF8.description: Solve for a quantity of interest in formulas used in science and mathematics using the same reasoning as in solving equations.

157331EB146D414194C861D55A14D5D6.description: Create systems of linear equations and inequalities to model situations in context.

B57568B367A541B2A2CB43D1B5428D53.description: Create and graph equations in two variables to represent linear, exponential, and quadratic relationships between quantities

EB8DC11C14984CDC86EF7EF453D25229.description: Create equations and inequalities in one variable that represent linear, exponential, and quadratic relationships and use them to solve problems.

1818CE89449F4B7993CE60F4E09CEAD5.description:
Creating Equations
Create equations that describe numbers or relationships

7A96BA937B4E4478BBD619067FC544CA.description: Understand the relationships among the factors of a quadratic expression, the solutions of a quadratic equation, and the zeros of a quadratic function.

A0B05AB22EED4014B6ADC6333EF70F45.description: Arithmetic with Polynomial Expressions Understand the relationship between zeros and factors of polynomials.

D840B9CBA47648BBA97ABDE3C1F150C8.description: Build an understanding that operations with polynomials are comparable to operations with integers by adding and subtracting quadratic expressions and by adding, subtracting, and multiplying linear expressions.

5274E9CCE92E4E8B980CA47794218A48.description: Arithmetic with Polynomial Expressions Perform arithmetic operations on polynomials

91DAB1F49935475B9CCB036B37DA5614.description: Write an equivalent form of a quadratic expression 𝑎𝑥 2 + 𝑏𝑥 + 𝑐, where a is an integer, by factoring to reveal the solutions of the equation or the zeros of the function the expression defines.

7E6F919AACA44458A5D98B7BE67F50E8.description: Seeing Structure in Expressions Write expressions in equivalent forms to solve problems

00BC28D1AEF04A4DA3C58862F92538A4.description: Interpret a linear, exponential, or quadratic expression made of multiple parts as a combination of entities to give meaning to an expression.

AE613D87AD5642CA8230D107E395F3F0.description: Identify and interpret parts of a linear, exponential, or quadratic expression, including terms, factors, coefficients, and exponents.

06036664D44B4F02847EE87805E521DF.description: Interpret expressions that represent a quantity in terms of its context

3977925C44AD46EBA46E2DBDCD7A6193.description: Seeing Structure in Expressions Interpret the structure of expressions.

199DC5FEFE8046C2BE77BAA5953BBAAB.description: Rewrite algebraic expressions with integer exponents using the properties of exponents.

7F626F3298374175874C0C2F29D93553.description:
The Real Number System
Extend the properties of exponents to rational exponents

624B70E4EC1642BBB2FA4328BC296A6A.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

98BA6C18585F4256BD3CF25EF7ED8E7A.description: Look for and make use of structure.

49FD67145E5A4B6186334CABA053EC97.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

0FB32994BF4D416381BD3516C8C8D7CC.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

7C25270193DD4F6D979C843E55093984.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math 1 (2018)
